thread.title: The week in numbers to Aug 14
thread.title_full: The week in numbers to Aug 14

author: news.com.au
title: The week in numbers to Aug 14
text:
THE big and small numbers that grabbed attention - or should have - in the business world over the past week.
MONDAY: $925 million - The Nine Network has beefed up its NRL broadcast rights in a new five year deal beginning in 2018 that is worth more than double its current rights.
Tuesday: 1.34 US cents - The Aussie dollar nosedived after China's central bank posted its largest currency devaluation on record. After hitting a peak of 74.41 US cents on Tuesday, the Aussie fell to a low of 73.07 cents shortly after the People's Bank of China devalued its currency by 1.85 per cent in a bid to prop up China's weakening export sector. Wednesday: $71.50 - Commonwealth Bank launched a massive $5 billion capital raising as it reported another record profit. The bank is offering existing investors one new share for every 23 they own at $71.50 each, a 10.5 per cent discount. Thursday: $14.5 million - Former Telstra chief executive David Thodey, who has previously admitted his salary was too big to justify, took home $14.5 million in his last year in the job. Friday: $20 million - Specialty Fashion Group has flagged an almost 50 per cent slide in full year earnings to between $20 million and $21 million, blaming its troubled Rivers brand, which it bought for $5 million in 2013.
